channel.title: Which sniper should i get?(airsoft)
channel.description:
Ok, before you read this, lets clear something up: If you hate airsoft, dont say "Get a real gun" or... "Airsoft sucks, paintball owns" and "Join the army then talk about guns.." if your going to say that, dont post at all.
Anyways... im having a hard time choosing between 2 l96 air soft sniper rifles [size=24pt]I WAS NOT INFLUENCED BY BLACK OPS, IVE BEEN LOOKING INTO GETTING ONE FOR ABOUT A YEAR NOW![/size] Anyways.. here are the candidates
WELL L96 http://www.airsplat.com/Items/AR-WELL-MB01BSB.htm
UTG L96 http://www.airsplat.com/Items/AR-UTG-AWP-368B.htm
Yes, i read the reviews, but im still not sure, i want to make the right decision, so what do you guys think? Dont pay attention to price or what it comes with, im talking about the gun itself. (Not appearance) [size=36pt]AT 6:30 PM PACIFIC WEST COAST TIME, I WILL CLOSE THE VOTES, AND MAKE A FINAL DECISION.[/size] Edit: Sorry, cant really remember the timezone :\ [size=14pt]WELL L96 it is! thanks for helping guys! :D[/size]

item.title: Which sniper should i get?(airsoft)
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Phaze One:

Excuse my non-american ignorance, what is airsoft?

en.wikipedia.org

Airsoft

Airsoft is a competitive team sport in which participants shoot opponents with spherical plastic BBs launched via replica weapons called airsoft guns. Airsoft is commonly compared to paintball, which is a recreational shooting sport similar in concept but with some key differences. Unlike paintballs, airsoft pellets do not mark their target, and hits are not always visibly apparent. Though the pellets will not leave red marks or "welts" on the targets’ exposed skin, the game relies heavily on an ...

item.title: Which sniper should i get?(airsoft)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Even though you have decided, I thought I would throw my feedback in.

I have the Well L96 and personally I love it. Many reviews say that the accuracy is very jumpy but I haven’t noticed a problem with it. It delivers a nice punch at long range and is accurate as long as the wind is down. However, many times the bullet doesn’t seem to align with the crosshairs but the sniper does not change the shot direction for me.

Buy some extra magazines if you can, the magazine is very annoying to reload even with the speed loader. If you run out during a war you will probably be out before you can reload anyway.

Some reviews may also say that it has a feeding problem. I honestly can’t say much to this as I haven’t used it enough to see a problem, but otherwise the feeding is pretty smooth.

Truth is, you get what you pay for usually. Most airsoft guns will encounter problems sooner or later, because plastic and cheap metal models can only last so long. I currently own (too lazy to look up the other brand names):

-Well L96
-AK47
-Uzi (propane)
-Several cheap plastic Wal-Mart guns. Honestly the only Wal-Mart gun that is worth the money is the shotgun. Even for a $20 white plastic gun it delivers a pretty strong force.

I can get pictures of my guns if you want. Also, sorry for the long post.

Read full topic

item.title: Which sniper should i get?(airsoft)
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

seems like the g22, is winning, guys, im saying this as of performance, not looks, else i would have gotten g22 long time ago :o

EDIT:
I decided to do some more research on google and look at some reviews, found out the mb04 has some cocking problems and magazine randomly pops out, and some other problems, reduced the choices to the UTG L96 and WELL L96.

Atm, im leaning towards the WELL model…
